explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 4 because of its flash point: 90degC

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains P-O bonds as chemical groups with self-reactive properties present.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Since measurements of flash points was made under temperatures higher than the room temperatures (94 degC) (ICSC (1997)), it was judged as not igniting spontaneously in normal temperatures, it was classified as outside of Category.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although the corrosion to steels is indicated (HSDB (2005)), since there are no other data, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 2 based on LD50=5.74 mg/kg calculated by nine data (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001), PIMs (1998)) of rats. In addition, only one data of PATTY (5th, 2001) described LD50 with dividing into racemic mixtures, S object, and R object. But all other data had particularly made reference about used isomer, it considered altogether that it was racemic mixtures. And it used only the value of racemic mixtures for calculation also from one data of PATTY (5th, 2001).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 2 based on LD50 = 147mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)) in rat dermal administration.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since the saturated vapor pressures concentrations pressure of this product is 0.49ppm, it is thought that the inhalation study was done in mist. Based on LC50 = 0.225mg/L (4-hour equivalent) which is the lower one among the rat inhalation 2 data (ACGIH (2001)), it was set as Category 2.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement that skin irritation was not indicated on rabbits (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified as out of Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is a statement that stimulation for the eyes of rabbits can be disregarded (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), and in humans, there are statements that an eye may be stimulated (ACGIH (2001)), and that when an eye are contacted, redness, a pain, and a blurred vision are produced (ICSC (1997)). It was set as Category 2A-2B based on the humans information.

carcinogenicity.rationale: We found no human over generation epidemiology, the over generation mutagenicity test, and the productive cell in vivo mutagenicity test, in addition, it gave negative for somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test (micronucleus test which used mouse bone marrow cells) (HSDB (2005)). Therefore we classified it as Out Of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since it was classified into A4 according to ACGIH (ACGIH-TLV(2005) cited in HSDB (2005)), it carried out the outside of Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is also a statement that parents' reproductive potential and the offsprings' growth and development were not affected in three-generation tests of rats (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)). Since there is a statement that in rabbit organogenetic-period administration tests, postimplantation death increased at a dose which is mildly toxic to maternal animals (HSDB (2005)), it was classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is the findings that suggest the effect to nervous system such as muscle fiber spasm, thrill, salivation, panting in the dose in the guidance value range of Category 1 in rat (ACGIH (2001)). There is the examples of nervous system disorders such as malevolence/vomiting, salivation, diaphoresis, muscle fiber spasm, myosis, dizziness, bleary eyes from the ingestion of this substance in human, and there is the description that there is the appearance of these symptoms as nervous symptom by the inhibition of cholinesterase. It is classified into Category 1 (nervous systems) from the above thing.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, liver, small intestine)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: There is a statement that in rats and dogs, the cholinesterase inhibition in red blood cell and plasma or serum, and histologic changes of small intestine and liver are observed in the dosage of guidance value within the limits of category 1(PATTY (5th, 2001), HSDB (2005)). There is a statement that in humans cholinesterase inhibition, depression, anxiety, convulsion and respiratory insufficiency etc. owing to neuropathy and hepatic dysfunction may be occured (ICSC (J), (1997), HSFS (1999), SITTIG (2002)). It was classified to as Category 1 (a nervous system, liver, small intestine) based on the above informations.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=1.09mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=3.94(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
